definition: to rain/(of rain, snow etc) to fall/to precipitate/to wet

sentences.english: Ultra lightweight and breathable Energy Cloak fabric.
sentences.chinese: 超輕量級和能源雨衣織物透氣。

sentences.english: Oh, that's terrible. Did you bring any raincoats?
sentences.chinese: 噢，那太可怕了。你們帶雨衣了嗎？

sentences.english: Some schools have their kids put on a poncho or raincoat to stay dry.
sentences.chinese: 有些學校給孩子們穿上鬥蓬或雨衣來維持乾燥。

sentences.english: A light gabardine raincoat of the type made by Burberry's of London.
sentences.chinese: 一種由防水棉布做成的輕便雨衣。

sentences.english: It's wet. Don't forget your umbrella and raincoat.
sentences.chinese: 下雨了很溼，別忘了你的雨傘和雨衣。

sentences.english: Another swathed himself in a raincoat and duct tape before fleeing the area a few hours later.
sentences.chinese: 另一面面和膠布雨衣前逃離該地區幾個小時後他自己。

sentences.english: Love is cleaning the pieces of ice off his raincoat.
sentences.chinese: 愛是清掉他雨衣上的冰片兒。

sentences.english: He put on his raincoat and soon disappeared in the rain.
sentences.chinese: 他穿上雨衣，很快便消失在雨幕中。

sentences.english: He passed by a waterfall. Many people who wore waterproof raincoat were taking pictures of the waterfall.
sentences.chinese: 很多穿着防水雨衣的人正在那裏怕瀑布的照片。

sentences.english: The numerous students with pink and blue raincoats made the view very magnificent.
sentences.chinese: 中小學生方陣裏大家披着粉色和藍色的雨衣格外壯觀。

sentences.english: You don't need your umbrella or raincoat.
He's remembered more generally for the raincoat that bears his name.
sentences.chinese: 他被人們普遍記得的是以他的名字命名的雨衣。

sentences.english: Your famous blue raincoat was torn at the shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 你那件出了名的藍雨衣連肩膀都磨破了。

sentences.english: In fact, he doesn't even think about bringing a raincoat.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，他甚至都沒想帶一件雨衣。

sentences.english: It was three days later that she remembered leaving /having left her raincoat in the language lad.
sentences.chinese: 過了三天她纔想起把雨衣忘在語言實驗室了。
